Package com.ibm.security.verifysdk

Class AuthenticatorContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.security.verifysdk.AuthenticatorContext
  • @RequiresApi(23)
public final class AuthenticatorContext
extends java.lang.Object
    A singleton class that represents an authenticator context for mobile applications to register a device against IBM Security Cloud and IBM Security Verify Access.

    The SDK automatically tries to refresh the authenticator's OAuth token if it has expired and re-submits the initial call. Because of this potential token update, one of the first steps in the callback should be updating the stored authenticator. Otherwise the renewed access and refresh token could get lost. If the SDK can not refresh the token, the corresponding error will be returned in the VerifySdkException object.

    Sample code: 

     
 AuthenticatorContext.sharedInstance().completeTransaction(mfaAuthenticator,
    		pendingTransaction.getPostbackUri(), signedData, userAction,
    		signatureAuthenticationMethod.getId(), pendingTransaction.getTransactionId(),
    	(type, verifySdkException) -> {

		DataStore.sharedInstance().saveAuthenticator(authenticator); // potential token refresh

		if (verifySdkException != null) {
 			// error handling
		}
 		...
 }
    To initiate a token refresh manually, call OAuthContext.refresh(String, String, String, String[], boolean, IResultCallback) with the required OAuth attributes and update the token in the authenticator afterwards.
    Since:
    2.0.0
    Version:
    2.1.5

      • create

        public void create​(@NonNull
                   IQRScanResult iqrScanResult,
                   @NonNull
                   IResultCallback<IAuthenticator> callback)
        Registers an authenticator instance for IBM Security Verify or custom mobile authenticators.

        It creates an IAuthenticator instance, according to the provided IQRScanResult input. The IResultCallback callback needs to be implemented by the developer and gets invoked with an authenticator and a VerifySdkException instance.

        If the authenticator could not be created, the authenticator instance in the callback will be null and the exception object contains the error information.

        Parameters:
        iqrScanResult - the result from the QR code scan.
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with authenticator and VerifySdkException.

      • create

        public void create​(@NonNull
                   IQRScanResult iqrScanResult,
                   @Nullable
                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> additionalData,
                   @NonNull
                   IResultCallback<IAuthenticator> callback)
        Registers an authenticator instance for IBM Security Verify or custom mobile authenticators with additional data.

        It creates an IAuthenticator instance, according to the provided IQRScanResult input. The IResultCallback callback needs to be implemented by the developer and gets invoked with an authenticator and a VerifySdkException instance.

        If the authenticator could not be created, the authenticator instance in the callback will be null and the exception object contains the error information.

        Parameters:
        iqrScanResult - the result from the QR code scan.
        additionalData - a map of additional data that will be added to the request body. This paramter is only taken into account for OnPremiseQRScan and will be ignored for others. The following restrictions are enforced: - max 10 entries - max length of key and value: 1024 Byte each - if the key name conflicts with a pre-existing key name from RegistrationAttributes, the latter takes precedence
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with authenticator and VerifySdkException.
        Since:
        2.1.4

      • login

        public void login​(@NonNull
                  IMfaAuthenticator mfaAuthenticator,
                  @NonNull
                  java.lang.String qrLoginEndpoint,
                  @NonNull
                  java.lang.String code,
                  @NonNull
                  IResultCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Handles a password-less login request to the given endpoint.

        This is only supported for OnPremise (IBM Access Manager 9.0.5 and above).

        The SDK initiates a token refresh if the initial call returns '401 - Unauthorized' and it re-tries that call again afterwards. Due the potential token refresh, it is recommended to store that renewed token as soon as possible (in the callback). An error gets populated in a VerifySdkException instance in the callback in this order:

        1. the first call fails, but not with a 401
        2. the token refresh fails
        3. the second attempt fails with any error
        Parameters:
        mfaAuthenticator - the authenticator that should login.
        qrLoginEndpoint - the endpoint to submit the login request.
        code - the login code from OnPremiseQRLoginScan.getLsi()
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with a null object and VerifySdkException.

      • login

        public void login​(@NonNull
                  IMfaAuthenticator mfaAuthenticator,
                  @NonNull
                  java.lang.String qrLoginEndpoint,
                  @NonNull
                  java.lang.String code,
                  boolean handleTokenRefresh,
                  @NonNull
                  IResultCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Handles a password-less login request to the given endpoint.

        This is only supported for OnPremise (IBM Access Manager 9.0.5 and above).

        Parameters:
        mfaAuthenticator - the authenticator that should login.
        qrLoginEndpoint - the endpoint to submit the login request.
        code - the login code from OnPremiseQRLoginScan.getLsi().
        handleTokenRefresh - indicator whether the SDK should initiate a token refresh if current token has expired. See login(IMfaAuthenticator, String, String, IResultCallback) for further details.
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with a null object and VerifySdkException.
        Since:
        2.0.5

      • nextTransaction

        public void nextTransaction​(@NonNull
                            IMfaAuthenticator mfaAuthenticator,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.String transactionId,
                            @NonNull
                            ITransactionResultCallback callback)
        Retrieves the next pending transaction with an optional transaction identifier.

        When transactionId is provided, the pending transaction matching the identifier is retrieved. This may not necessarily be the next transaction available.

        The SDK initiates a token refresh if the initial call returns '401 - Unauthorized' and it re-tries that call again afterwards. Due the potential token refresh, it is recommended to store that renewed token as soon as possible (in the callback). An error gets populated in a VerifySdkException instance in the callback in this order:

        1. the first call fails, but not with a 401
        2. the token refresh fails
        3. the second attempt fails with any error
        Parameters:
        mfaAuthenticator - an instance of the authenticator.
        transactionId - the identifier of the transaction.
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with PendingTransaction, the count of pending transactions and VerifySdkException.

      • nextTransaction

        public void nextTransaction​(@NonNull
                            IMfaAuthenticator mfaAuthenticator,
                            @Nullable
                            java.lang.String transactionId,
                            boolean handleTokenRefresh,
                            @NonNull
                            ITransactionResultCallback callback)
        Retrieves the next pending transaction with an optional transaction identifier.

        When transactionId is provided, the pending transaction matching the identifier is retrieved. This may not necessarily be the next transaction available.

        Parameters:
        mfaAuthenticator - an instance of the authenticator.
        transactionId - the identifier of the transaction.
        handleTokenRefresh - indicator whether the SDK should initiate a token refresh if current token has expired. See nextTransaction(IMfaAuthenticator, String, ITransactionResultCallback) for further details.
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with PendingTransaction, the count of pending transactions and VerifySdkException.
        Since:
        2.0.5

      • completeTransaction

        public void completeTransaction​(@NonNull
                                IMfaAuthenticator mfaAuthenticator,
                                @NonNull
                                java.lang.String postbackUri,
                                @NonNull
                                java.lang.String signedData,
                                @NonNull
                                UserAction userAction,
                                @NonNull
                                java.lang.String signatureMethodId,
                                @NonNull
                                java.lang.String transactionId,
                                @NonNull
                                IResultCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Fulfills a specific verification transaction associated with a registered authenticator instance.

        When userAction is UserAction.verify, the signedData value must be supplied as a Base64 URL encoded value. This value is the result of signing the PendingTransaction.getDataToSign() value with the private key created for this enrollment.

        The SDK initiates a token refresh if the initial call returns '401 - Unauthorized' and it re-tries that call again afterwards. Due the potential token refresh, it is recommended to store that renewed token as soon as possible (in the callback). An error gets populated in a VerifySdkException instance in the callback in this order:

        1. the first call fails, but not with a 401
        2. the token refresh fails
        3. the second attempt fails with any error
        Parameters:
        mfaAuthenticator - the instance of the authenticator.
        postbackUri - the transaction verification URL to post to.
        signedData - the signed data to include with the verification.
        userAction - the enumerated type of user actions that can be performed on a transaction.
        signatureMethodId - the ID of the authentication method enrollment. Obtain this value from SignatureAuthenticationMethod.getId().
        transactionId - the ID of the transaction.
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with null and VerifySdkException.

      • completeTransaction

        public void completeTransaction​(@NonNull
                                IMfaAuthenticator mfaAuthenticator,
                                @NonNull
                                java.lang.String postbackUri,
                                @NonNull
                                java.lang.String signedData,
                                @NonNull
                                UserAction userAction,
                                @NonNull
                                java.lang.String signatureMethodId,
                                @NonNull
                                java.lang.String transactionId,
                                boolean handleTokenRefresh,
                                @NonNull
                                IResultCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Fulfills a specific verification transaction associated with a registered authenticator instance.

        When userAction is UserAction.verify, the signedData value must be supplied as a Base64 URL encoded value. This value is the result of signing the PendingTransaction.getDataToSign() value with the private key created for this enrollment.

        Parameters:
        mfaAuthenticator - the instance of the authenticator.
        postbackUri - the transaction verification URL to post to.
        signedData - the signed data to include with the verification.
        userAction - the enumerated type of user actions that can be performed on a transaction.
        signatureMethodId - the ID of the authentication method enrollment. Obtain this value from SignatureAuthenticationMethod.getId().
        transactionId - the ID of the transaction.
        handleTokenRefresh - indicator whether the SDK should initiate a token refresh if current token has expired. See completeTransaction(IMfaAuthenticator, String, String, UserAction, String, String, IResultCallback) for further details.
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with null and VerifySdkException.
        Since:
        2.0.5

      • remove

        public void remove​(@NonNull
                   IMfaAuthenticator mfaAuthenticator,
                   @NonNull
                   IResultCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Remove the authenticator from the server.

        Currently this feature is constrained to OnPremiseAuthenticator.

        The SDK initiates a token refresh if the initial call returns '401 - Unauthorized' and it re-tries that call again afterwards. Due the potential token refresh, it is recommended to store that renewed token as soon as possible (in the callback). An error gets populated in a VerifySdkException instance in the callback in this order:

        1. the first call fails, but not with a 401
        2. the token refresh fails
        3. the second attempt fails with any error
        Parameters:
        mfaAuthenticator - the authenticator to be removed.
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with null and VerifySdkException.

      • remove

        public void remove​(@NonNull
                   IMfaAuthenticator mfaAuthenticator,
                   boolean handleTokenRefresh,
                   @NonNull
                   IResultCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Remove the authenticator from the server.

        Currently this feature is constrained to OnPremiseAuthenticator.

        Parameters:
        mfaAuthenticator - the authenticator to be removed.
        handleTokenRefresh - indicator whether the SDK should initiate a token refresh if current token has expired. See remove(IMfaAuthenticator, IResultCallback) for further details.
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with null and VerifySdkException.
        Since:
        2.0.5

      • enroll

        public void enroll​(@NonNull
                   IMfaAuthenticator mfaAuthenticator,
                   @NonNull
                   IResultCallback<java.util.List<VerifySdkException>> callback)
        Enroll a new instance of a TotpAuthenticationMethod instance for a user. The shared secret seed is automatically generated. The maximum number of enrolled TOTP instances that are allowed is one.
        Parameters:
        mfaAuthenticator - the instance of the authenticator.
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with a list of VerifySdkException, representing errors with the enrollment on server side.

      • enroll

        public void enroll​(@NonNull
                   IMfaAuthenticator mfaAuthenticator,
                   @NonNull
                   java.util.List<SignatureAuthenticationMethod> signatureAuthenticationMethods,
                   @NonNull
                   IResultCallback<java.util.List<VerifySdkException>> callback)
        Enroll one or more instances of a SignatureAuthenticationMethod for a user. The user who will own the new enrollments is the owner of the access token. Only SignatureAuthenticationMethods that are server-side marked as enabled get attempt to enroll.

        Enrollments of signature authentication methods are restricted to the initial access token that is issued at time of registration. After a successful refresh of the registration all future enrollments will be rejected.

        For cloud based enrollments, the method automatically appends the flag for a multi-status response body upon success.

        Parameters:
        mfaAuthenticator - the instance of the authenticator.
        signatureAuthenticationMethods - a list of signature authentication methods that should be enrolled.
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with a list of VerifySdkException.

      • refresh

        public void refresh​(@NonNull
                    IMfaAuthenticator mfaAuthenticator,
                    @NonNull
                    IResultCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Refresh a specific registered authenticator instance for IBM Security Verify or custom mobile authenticators. Registrations are embodied by an OAuth grant. This endpoint allows requesters to manage a specific OAuth authorized grant.

        The IMfaAuthenticator.getOauthToken() and IMfaAuthenticator.getAvailableMethods() properties are updated within this function.

        Parameters:
        mfaAuthenticator - the instance of the authenticator.
        callback - the function delegate that is invoked with a null object and VerifySdkException.
